title: GO TELL THE BEES THAT I AM GONE
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: The ninth book in the Outlander series. As the Revolutionary War moves closer to Fraser’s Ridge, Claire and Jamie reunite with their daughter and her family.

title: THE BECOMING
author: Nora Roberts
description: The second book in the Dragon Heart Legacy series. Breen returns to Talamh as her grandfather Odran plots destruction.

title: FEAR NO EVIL
author: James Patterson
description: The 29th book in the Alex Cross series. Cross fights the mastermind who has stalked him for years.

title: THE JUDGE'S LIST
author: John Grisham
description: The second book in the Whistler series. Investigator Lacy Stoltz goes after a serial killer and closes in on a sitting judge.

title: THE WISH
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: Maggie Dawes, a renowned travel photographer, struggles with a medical diagnosis over Christmas.

title: FLYING ANGELS
author: Danielle Steel
description: Six women join the Medical Air Evacuation Transport Squadron during World War II.

title: IT ENDS WITH US
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.

title: THE STRANGER IN THE LIFEBOAT
author: Mitch Albom
description: After a ship explodes, 10 people struggling to survive pull a man who claims to be the Lord out of the sea.

title: MERCY
author: David Baldacci
description: The fourth book in the Atlee Pine series. Atlee discovers her twin sister survived an abduction at the age of 6.

title: THE LINCOLN HIGHWAY
author: Amor Towles
description: Two friends who escaped from a juvenile work farm take Emmett Watson on an unexpected journey to New York City in 1954.

title: THE DARK HOURS
author: Michael Connelly
description: A death on New Year’s Eve, an unsolved murder and a hunt for serial rapists bring Bosch and Ballard back together.

title: THE CHRISTMAS PROMISE
author: Richard Paul Evans
description: Richelle writes a book about her estranged and deceased twin sister, Michelle, that is titled “The Prodigal Daughter.”

title: THE SEVEN HUSBANDS OF EVELYN HUGO
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer.

title: STATE OF TERROR
author: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Louise Penny
description: In the wake of the previous administration’s mishandling of international affairs, the new Secretary of State Ellen Adams confronts interconnected global threats.

title: PROJECT HAIL MARY
author: Andy Weir
description: Ryland Grace awakes from a long sleep alone and far from home, and the fate of humanity rests on his shoulders.

author: James Patterson and Michael Ledwidge
description: The New York detective Michael Bennett enlists the help of a former colleague to solve a rash of horrifying crimes that are throwing the city into chaos.

author: Stieg Larsson
description: A hacker and a journalist investigate the disappearance of a Swedish heiress 40 years earlier; the first volume in the Millennium trilogy.

title: WATER FOR ELEPHANTS
author: Sara Gruen
description: After his parents die in a car accident, young veterinary student — and an elephant — save a Depression-era circus.

title: THE GIRL WHO PLAYED WITH FIRE
author: Stieg Larsson
description: In the second volume of the Millennium trilogy, a Swedish hacker becomes a murder suspect.

title: THE GIRL WHO KICKED THE HORNET’S NEST
author: Stieg Larsson
description: The third volume of the Millennium trilogy, about a Swedish hacker and a journalist.

title: A DISCOVERY OF WITCHES
author: Deborah Harkness
description: The recovery of a lost ancient manuscript in a library at Oxford sets a fantastical underworld stirring.

title: DREAMS OF A DARK WARRIOR
author: Kresley Cole
description: Murdered before he could marry, a Celtic warrior seeks his beloved through eternity.

title: CUTTING FOR STONE
author: Abraham Verghese
description: Twin brothers, conjoined at birth and then separated, grow up amid the political turmoil of Ethiopia.

title: THE HELP
author: Kathryn Stockett
description: A young white woman and two black maids in 1960s Mississippi.

title: THE CONFESSION
author: John Grisham
description: A criminal wants to save an innocent man on death row, but he must convince the authorities he’s telling the truth.

title: HER LAST LETTER
author: Nancy C Johnson
description: A victim of a hit-and-run leaves behind a letter that throws her family into turmoil.

title: DEAD OR ALIVE
author: Tom Clancy with Grant Blackwood
description: Familiar Clancy characters appear as an intelligence group tracks a vicious terrorist called the Emir.

title: ROOM
author: Emma Donoghue
description: The entire world of the 5-year-old boy who narrates this novel is the 11-by-11-foot room in which his mother is being held prisoner.

title: HOTEL ON THE CORNER OF BITTER AND SWEET
author: Jamie Ford
description: A friendship between a Chinese-American boy and a Japanese-American girl in Seattle during World War II.

title: MARRYING DAISY BELLAMY
author: Susan Wiggs
description: A woman struggles for years to choose between two men, one honorable and steady, one wild and untethered. And then, one fateful day, the decision is made for her.

title: THE LOST SYMBOL
author: Dan Brown
description: The Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon among the Masons.

title: THE POSTMISTRESS
author: Sarah Blake
description: A tale of two worlds and two women delivering the news in 1940: Iris James, a spinster who runs the post office in a coastal Massachusetts town, and Frankie Bard, a reporter in London with Edward R. Murrow.

author: Chris Cleave
description: The lives of two women collide: a Nigerian refugee and an English magazine editor to whose home the refugee escapes after fleeing an immigration detention center.

author: Emma Donoghue
description: The entire world of the 5-year-old boy who narrates this novel is the 11-by-11-foot room in which his mother is being held prisoner.

title: FALLEN
author: Karin Slaughter
description: The mother of the Georgia cop Faith Mitchell is taken hostage, and the evidence unveils police corruption, bribery and murder.

title: 10TH ANNIVERSARY
author: James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
description: Detective Lindsay Boxer and the Women’s Murder Club race to find a missing baby.

title: THE GIRL WITH THE DRAGON TATTOO
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A hacker and a journalist investigate the disappearance of a Swedish heiress 40 years earlier.

title: BURIED PREY
author: John Sandford
description: For 25 years the unsolved kidnapping of two girls has haunted the Minneapolis detective Lucas Davenport. But now, their bodies have been found.

title: SIZZLING SIXTEEN
author: Janet Evanovich
description: The bounty hunter Stephanie Plum comes to the aid of a cousin with gambling debts.

title: CARTE BLANCHE
author: Jeffery Deaver
description: A young James Bond, on a global mission for a unit of British security, must foil a plot to kill thousands of citizens.

title: UNLOCKED
author: Courtney Milan
description: What’s tormenting the Earl of Westfeld may be the stirrings of love for his former victim, the perpetual wallflower Lady Elaine Warren.

title: THE GIRL WHO KICKED THE HORNET’S NEST
author: Stieg Larsson
description: In the last volume of the Millennium trilogy, Mikael Blomkvist and Lisbeth Salander are threatened by an adversary from deep within the government.

title: SMOKIN’ SEVENTEEN
author: Janet Evanovich
description: A killer is after the bounty hunter Stephanie Plum, who faces further complications as she tries to choose a boyfriend.

title: THE HELP
author: Kathryn Stockett
description: A young white woman and two black maids in 1960s Mississippi.

title: A GAME OF THRONES
author: George RR Martin
description: In the frozen wastes to the north of Winterfell, sinister and supernatural forces are mustering.

title: WATER FOR ELEPHANTS
author: Sara Gruen
description: After his parents are killed in a car accident, a young veterinary student — and an elephant — save a Depression-era circus.

title: AGAINST ALL ENEMIES
author: Tom Clancy with Peter Telep
description: Maxwell Moore pursues the terrorists who killed his C.I.A. colleagues in a bomb attack in Pakistan.

title: THE DEVIL COLONY
author: James Rollins
description: The discovery of a lost colony reveals a conspiracy from the nation’s founding; a Sigma Force novel.

title: STATE OF WONDER
author: Ann Patchett
description: In the Amazon basin, a medical researcher searches for her former mentor, a despotic scientist who is developing a miracle fertility drug.

author: George RR Martin
description: From the citadel of Dragonstone to the shores of Winterfell, factions vie for control of a divided land; Book 2 of "A Song of Ice and Fire."

author: David Baldacci
description: As Christmas nears, a terminally ill man is preparing his family for his death when another tragedy strikes.

author: Elin Hilderbrand
description: The wife of a Wall Street crook retreats to Nantucket, where she faces an array of relationship troubles.

description: While Bailey Flanigan pursues her dream of being an actress in New York, Cody coaches small-town high school football.

author: Janet Evanovich
description: After a disastrous vacation in Hawaii, Stephanie Plum becomes the target of an international killer.

title: THE GIRL WHO KICKED THE HORNET’S NEST
author: Stieg Larsson
description: The third volume of the Millennium trilogy, about a Swedish hacker and a journalist.

title: RED MIST
author: Patricia Cornwell
description: The chief medical examiner Kay Scarpetta investigates a string of killings linked to the murder of her former deputy.

title: LOCKED ON
author: Tom Clancy with Mark Greaney
description: Jack Ryan Jr. must stop an emerging threat from a Pakistani general.

title: UNFINISHED BUSINESS
author: Nora Roberts
description: Former high school sweethearts fall tentatively back into each other’s orbits after more than a decade.

title: THE DROP
author: Michael Connelly
description: Harry Bosch of the L.A.P.D. uncovers both the operations of a sadistic killer and a political conspiracy.

title: DOWN THE DARKEST ROAD
author: Tami Hoag
description: Looking for a fresh start after a family tragedy, Lauren and her daughter move to idyllic Oak Knoll. But a cunning predator is on the hunt, and it soon feels as if history is repeating itself.

title: DEATH COMES TO PEMBERLEY
author: P D James
description: Six years after Elizabeth and Darcy marry, their comfortable life is shaken by a murder, as James recreates the world of “Pride and Prejudice” with a mysterious twist.

title: EXTREMELY LOUD AND INCREDIBLY CLOSE
author: Jonathan Safran Foer
description: A precocious boy goes on a scavenger hunt through New York’s five boroughs in search of the lock that fits a key belonging to his father, who died on Sept. 11.

title: THE HELP
author: Kathryn Stockett
description: A young white woman and two black maids in 1960s Mississippi.

title: THE GIRL WITH THE DRAGON TATTOO
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A hacker and a journalist investigate the disappearance of a Swedish heiress 40 years earlier.

author: Stephen King
description: An English teacher travels back to 1958 by way of a time portal in a Maine diner. His assignment is to stop Lee Harvey Oswald.

title: KILL ALEX CROSS
author: James Patterson
description: Alex Cross investigates when the president’s children are kidnapped, but the F.BI. and C.I.A. interfere.

title: THE LITIGATORS
author: John Grisham
description: Partners in a small law firm take on a big case after a fast-track burnout joins them.

title: THE GIRL WHO PLAYED WITH FIRE
author: Stieg Larsson
description: In the second volume of the Millennium trilogy, a Swedish hacker becomes a murder suspect.

title: THE BEST OF ME
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A man and woman who have gone their separate ways return to their Southern town for the funeral of a friend.

title: 77 SHADOW STREET
author: Dean Koontz
description: A 19th-century tycoon’s mansion turned into luxury apartments remains in the grip of evil forces.

title: WATER FOR ELEPHANTS
author: Sara Gruen
description: After his parents die in a car accident, a young veterinary student — and an elephant — save a Depression-era circus.

title: HIDDEN SUMMIT
author: Ron Carr
description: Sick of her ex-husband and his new wife, Leslie Petruso meets someone else who thinks he’s done with love.

title: SPIRIT BOUND
author: Christine Feehan
description: In the town of Sea Haven, an undercover agent insinuates himself into the life of an elusive woman with ties to the crime lord he’s determined to trap.

author: Jonathan Kellerman

author: Stieg Larsson
description: Volume 3 of the Millennium trilogy, about a Swedish hacker and a journalist.

title: THE LUCKY ONE
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A Marine returning home sets out to track down the woman whose photo he found in Iraq.

author: Gena Showalter
description: A blood feud between ancient enemies could keep the immortal warrior Paris from the woman he craves above all others.

title: DEFENDING JACOB
author: William Landay
description: An assistant district attorney’s life is shaken when his 14-year-old son is accused of murder.

author: Vince Flynn
description: Mitch Rapp, a C.I.A. super-agent hunting down perpetrators of the Pan Am Lockerbie bombing, finds himself caught in a dangerous trap.

title: THE HELP
author: Kathryn Stockett
description: A young white woman and two black maids in 1960s Mississippi.

title: THE SWEETEST THING
author: Barbara Freethy
description: An entrepreneur must deal with the sudden death of his ex-wife and the appearance of a beautiful redhead.

title: PRIVATE GAMES
author: James Patterson and Mark Sullivan
description: Peter Knight pursues a murderer who is trying to destroy the London Olympics.

title: CELEBRITY IN DEATH
author: J D Robb
description: Lt. Eve Dallas investigates when an actress drowns at an opening night party; by Nora Roberts, writing pseudonymously.

author: Lisa Kleypas
description: Lucy is shaken when her fiancé leaves her for her sister. But the new love of Lucy’s life is not all he seems.

author: E L James
description: Ana Steele learns more about Christian Grey’s troubled past; the second book in a trilogy.

author: Gillian Flynn
description: A woman disappears on the day of her fifth anniversary; is her husband a killer?

title: BARED TO YOU
author: Sylvia Day
description: Two troubled people develop an intense, obsessive relationship.

title: CRIMINAL
author: Karin Slaughter
description: Will Trent of the Georgia Bureau of Investigation and his supervisor, Amanda Wagner, confront mysteries from the past.

title: SAMURAI GAME
author: Christine Feehan
description: A seductive employee of an underground club is playing a dangerous game of blackmail, politics and murder that reaches into the shadowy world of the GhostWalkers.

title: THE NEXT BEST THING
author: Jennifer Weiner
description: A young woman who moves to Hollywood to make it in television finds success, but her life remains complicated.

title: FIFTY SHADES TRILOGY
author: E L James
description: The three “Fifty Shades” novels in one bundle.

title: THE LITIGATORS
author: John Grisham
description: Partners in a small law firm take on a big case.

title: ECHOES AT DAWN
author: Maya Banks
description: Rio, a member of an elite, family-run task force, is enlisted to protect a desperate woman with an extraordinary ability to heal others.

title: THE MARRIAGE BARGAIN
author: Jennifer Probst
description: A billionaire who needs a wife offers a one-year marriage in name only to a bookstore owner.

title: A GAME OF THRONES
author: George RR Martin
description: In the frozen wastes to the north of Winterfell, sinister and supernatural forces are mustering.

title: WICKED BUSINESS
author: Janet Evanovich
description: The Salem, Mass., pastry chef Lizzy Tucker and her partner, Diesel, seach for a powerful ancient relic.

title: ABRAHAM LINCOLN: VAMPIRE HUNTER
author: Seth Grahame-Smith
description: A journal reveals Lincoln’s fight against the undead.

title: SUMMERLAND
author: Elin Hilderbrand
description: A graduation night celebration in Nantucket ends in tragedy after a horrible car crash. As summer unfolds, startling truths are revealed about the survivors and their parents.

title: 11TH HOUR
author: James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
description: When a millionaire is gunned down, Detective Lindsay Boxer and the Women's Murder Club discover that the murder weapon is linked to the deaths of four of San Francisco's most untouchable criminals.

title: BLOODLINE
author: James Rollins
description: A deadly rescue mission in the African jungle and a clinic bombing in South Carolina both reveal a dangerous conspiracy; a Sigma Force novel.

title: THE INNOCENT
author: David Baldacci
description: When something about his latest mission seems wrong, the government assassin Will Robie refuses to kill. Now he’s a target himself.

title: THE AGE OF MIRACLES
author: Karen Thompson Walker
description: A girl comes of age as an apocalypse caused by a slowing of the earth’s rotation looms.

description: Partners in a small law firm take on a big case.

author: Maya Banks
description: Rio, a member of an elite, family-run task force, is enlisted to protect a desperate woman with an extraordinary ability to heal others.

author: Jennifer Probst
description: A billionaire who needs a wife offers a one-year marriage in name only to a bookstore owner.

title: A GAME OF THRONES
author: George RR Martin
description: In the frozen wastes to the north of Winterfell, sinister and supernatural forces are mustering.

author: Janet Evanovich
description: The Salem, Mass., pastry chef Lizzy Tucker and her partner, Diesel, seach for a powerful ancient relic.

description: A journal reveals Lincoln’s fight against the undead.

author: Elin Hilderbrand
description: A graduation night celebration in Nantucket ends in tragedy after a horrible car crash. As summer unfolds, startling truths are revealed about the survivors and their parents.

title: 11TH HOUR
author: James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
description: When a millionaire is gunned down, Detective Lindsay Boxer and the Women's Murder Club discover that the murder weapon is linked to the deaths of four of San Francisco's most untouchable criminals.

author: James Rollins
description: A deadly rescue mission in the African jungle and a clinic bombing in South Carolina both reveal a dangerous conspiracy; a Sigma Force novel.

description: When something about his latest mission seems wrong, the government assassin Will Robie refuses to kill. Now he’s a target himself.

author: Karen Thompson Walker
description: A girl comes of age as an apocalypse caused by a slowing of the earth’s rotation looms.

author: E L James
description: An inexperienced college student falls in love with a tortured man who has particular sexual tastes; the first book in a trilogy.

description: The final book in an erotic trilogy.

description: An imprisoned ex-lawyer schemes to exchange this information about who murdered a judge for his freedom.

title: TENTH OF DECEMBER
author: George Saunders
description: Stories that take on the big questions.

title: DREAM EYES
author: Jayne Ann Krentz
description: A psychic counselor, returning to a small Oregon town after her mentor’s suspicious death, is drawn to a psychic investigator with disturbing power; a Dark Legacy novel.

title: THE HUSBAND LIST
author: Janet Evanovich and Dorien Kelly
description: In New York City in 1894, a wealthy young woman yearns for adventure and the love of an Irish-American with new money, rather than the titled Britons to whom her mother hopes to marry her off.

title: THE BLOOD GOSPEL
author: James Rollins and Rebecca Cantrell
description: A hunt for the truth about a shadowy ancient order and a book supposed to have been written in Christ’s own hand; the first book in a series, the Order of the Sanguines.

author: Abbi Glines
description: A sheltered 19-year-old girl falls in love with her spoiled, sexy stepbrother.

description: In a case that spans 20 years, the Los Angeles detective Harry Bosch links a recent crime to the killing of a photographer amid the 1992 race riots.

description: Women are being abducted in London, and two investigators — the former Royal Military Police sergeant Dan Carter and his ex-wife, Kirsty Webb — are in a race against the odds.

description: The 14th and final novel in the Wheel of Time fantasy series.

description: Seven books by seven authors about bad boys and the women who love them.

title: BOMBSHELL
author: Catherine Coulter
description: The F.B.I. special agent Griffin Hammersmith accepts Dillon Savich’s invitation to join him and Lacey Sherlock.

title: LOST AND FOUND IN CEDAR COVE
author: Debbie Macomber
description: In this short story, Jo Marie Rose readies her bed-and-breakfast for spring.

title: THE OCEAN AT THE END OF THE LANE
author: Neil Gaiman
description: A middle-aged man recalls his lonely boyhood and his friendship with a remarkable girl.

title: ENDER'S GAME
author: Orson Scott Card
description: Government agencies breed child geniuses and train them as soldiers. Originally published in 1985.

title: ENTWINED WITH YOU
author: Sylvia Day
description: Eva and Gideon face the demons of their pasts and accept the consequences of their obsessive desires; a Crossfire novel.

title: FRIGID
author: J Lynn
description: Sydney and Kyler, childhood friends, must confront their feelings for each other when they are stranded during a storm at a ski resort where they are being stalked.

title: THE BILLIONAIRE'S OBSESSION
author: J S Scott
description: A set of all the books in this series, about a down-on-her luck nursing student rescued by a reclusive billionaire.

title: DEADLY STAKES
author: J A Jance
description: Ali Reynolds, a former reporter investigating the murder of a gold-digging divorcee is intrigued by the  teenager who discovered the body in the desert.

title: THE WITNESS
author: Sandra Brown
description: A public defender who seems happy in her work and her marriage is plunged into a morass of bigotry and hate.

title: THE CUCKOO'S CALLING
author: Robert Galbraith
description: The struggling detective Cormoran Strike investigates a supermodel’s suicide; by J.K. Rowling, writing pseudonymously.

title: THE ENGLISH GIRL
author: Daniel Silva
description: Gabriel Allon, an art restorer and occasional spy for the Israeli secret service, steps in to help the British prime minister, whose lover has been kidnapped.

title: FIRST SIGHT
author: Danielle Steel
description: A talented American designer whose troubled past has soured her on relationships falls in love with a French doctor.

title: INFERNO
author: Dan Brown
description: The symbologist Robert Langdon, on the run in Florence, must decipher a series of codes created by a Dante-loving scientist.

title: HUNTING EVE
author: Iris Johansen
description: In the second book of a trilogy, the forensic sculptor Eve Duncan struggles to elude a kidnapper in the Colorado wilderness.

title: SECOND HONEYMOON
author: James Patterson and Howard Roughan
description: The F.B.I. agent John O’Hara investigates the murder of a pair of newlyweds.

title: HIDDEN ORDER
author: Brad Thor
description: The counterterrorism operative Scot Harvath uncovers a plot with roots in the 18th century.

title: AND THE MOUNTAINS ECHOED
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A multigenerational family saga centers on a brother and sister born in Afghanistan.

title: PULSE
author: Gail McHugh
description: In a sequel to “Collide,” Emily Cooper risks everything on her romance with the playboy Gavin Blake.

author: Gillian Flynn
description: A woman disappears on the day of her fifth anniversary; is her husband a killer?

description: Reverse eco-terrorists create natural disasters to convince the public that global warming is real. Originally published in 2004.

title: THE NIGHTINGALE
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Two sisters are separated in World War II France: one in the countryside, the other in Paris.

title: CIRCLING THE SUN
author: Paula McLain
description: A novel by the author of “The Paris Wife” about Beryl Markham, a horse trainer and aviatrix raised in Kenya.

title: DEVIL'S BRIDGE
author: Linda Fairstein
description: In her 17th outing, prosecutor Alexandra Cooper disappears, and her colleague, an N.Y.P.D. detective, is assigned the task of finding her.

title: CODE OF CONDUCT
author: Brad Thor
description: The counterterrorism operative Scot Harvath undertakes a deadly assignment set in motion by a leaked video.

title: LUCKIEST GIRL ALIVE
author: Jessica Knoll
description: The life of a successful magazine writer is shaken when secrets from her past are revealed in a documentary.

title: DARK PLACES
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A woman who, as a child, was spared when her mother and sisters were murdered begins to reinvestigate the case against her imprisoned brother.

title: FOOL'S QUEST
author: Robin Hobb
description: In the second volume of the “Fitz and the Fool” trilogy, Fitz draws on ancient magic to save his friend, the Fool.

title: ACCUSED
author: Lisa Scottoline
description: Mary DiNunzio is now a partner at the all-women Philadelphia law firm of Rosato & Associates.

title: GO SET A WATCHMAN
author: Harper Lee
description: In the mid-1950s, a grown-up Jean Louise Finch returns to Maycomb and realizes that her adored father is a racist.

title: THE GIRL ON THE TRAIN
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller set in the environs of London is full of complications and betrayals.

title: SILVER LININGS
author: Debbie Macomber
description: Jo Marie, keeper of the Rose Harbor Inn, and two guests deal with trouble in relationships.

title: WHO DO YOU LOVE
author: Jennifer Weiner
description: Andy and Rachel meet as children, then come together and separate repeatedly over the years.

title: GREY
author: E L James
description: A sequel, told from Christian’s point of view, revisits the tortured romance between the controlling billionaire and the unassuming Ana.

title: ALERT
author: James Patterson and Michael Ledwidge
description: Detective Michael Bennett and the F.B.I.’s Emily Parker must save New York City from a deadly threat.

title: ALL THE LIGHT WE CANNOT SEE
author: Anthony Doerr
description: The lives of a blind French girl and a gadget-obsessed German boy before and during World War II; the winner of the 2015 Pulitzer Prize.

title: THE MARTIAN
author: Andy Weir
description: Abandoned by his crew, an astronaut embarks on a dogged quest to stay alive.

title: FLESH AND BLOOD
author: Patricia Cornwell
description: Dr. Kay Scarpetta pursues a sniper who may be a vigilante; the 22nd Scarpetta novel.

description: The psychologist Alex Delaware and the L.A.P.D. Lt. Milo Sturgis search for the missing son of a troubled actress.

title: THE STRANGER
author: Harlan Coben
description: When a woman's devastating secret is mysteriously revealed to her husband, much more than their marriage is suddenly in danger.

title: THE REVENANT
author: Michael Punke
description: Left for dead after a mauling, the master tracker Hugh Glass is consumed by a singular desire for revenge; an inspiration for the 2015 film.

title: BACKWARD GLANCE
author: Ron Carr
description: A meddling mother schemes to get her daughter and a handyman back together.

title: UNFINISHED BUSINESS
author: Nora Roberts
description: Former high school sweethearts fall tentatively back into each other’s orbits after more than a decade.

title: COMETH THE HOUR
author: Jeffrey Archer
description: The sixth and penultimate book of the Clifton Chronicles brings the Cliftons and the Barringtons into the 1970s.

title: ME BEFORE YOU
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A woman who has barely been beyond her English village finds herself while caring for a wealthy, embittered quadriplegic.

title: ROOMHATE
author: Penelope Ward
description: A woman must share an inherited house with the man she dumped long ago.

title: FIND HER
author: Lisa Gardner
description: The detective D.  D. Warren hunts for a missing woman who was kidnapped and abused as a student and may have become a vigilante.

title: THE NIGHTINGALE
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Two sisters are separated in World War II France: one in the countryside, the other in Paris.

title: NYPD RED 4
author: James Patterson and Marshall Karp
description: Detective Zach Jordan and his partner pursue a cold-blooded killer.

title: BROTHERHOOD IN DEATH
author: J D Robb
description: Lt. Eve Dallas of the N.Y.P.D. helps a friend and her husband solve a mystery involving politics and real estate; by Nora Roberts, writing pseudonymously.

title: ALL THE LIGHT WE CANNOT SEE
author: Anthony Doerr
description: The lives of a blind French girl and a gadget-obsessed German boy before and during World War II.

title: THE GIRL ON THE TRAIN
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller set in the environs of London is full of complications and betrayals.

title: THE NEXT ALWAYS
author: Nora Roberts
description: A historic hotel in Maryland is getting a face-lift from the Montgomery brothers and their eccentric mother; Book 1 of the Inn BoonsBoro trilogy.

title: THE LIE
author: Karina Halle
description: Brigs and Natasha each look to turn from their tragic pasts with a fresh start in London.

title: THE WIDOW
author: Fiona Barton
description: When a suspect in a missing-child case dies, reporters and the police think they’ll get the real story from his widow. They’re wrong.

title: THE MARTIAN
author: Andy Weir
description: Abandoned by his crew, an astronaut embarks on a dogged quest to stay alive.

title: THE CHOICE
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: When Travis meets his new neighbor, his bachelor status erodes.

author: Stephen King
description: An English teacher travels back to 1958 by way of a time portal in a Maine diner. His assignment is to stop Lee Harvey Oswald.

description: A hired killer and a woman he kidnapped join forces to elude the F.B.I. agents and others who are searching for her corrupt brother.

title: TRULY MADLY GUILTY
author: Liane Moriarty
description: Tense turning points for three couples at a backyard barbecue gone wrong.

title: FIRST STAR I SEE TONIGHT
author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips
description: A former quarterback hires a detective to scope out the employees at his high-end nightclub.

title: A MAN CALLED OVE
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A curmudgeon's gruff exterior masks a generosity of spirit. Originally published in Sweden in 2014.

title: BULLSEYE
author: James Patterson and Michael Ledwidge
description: Detective Michael Bennett must stop a team of assassins prowling the Upper West Side.

title: ANTI-STEPBROTHER
author: Tijan
description: Summer heads to college with designs on her stepbrother, but his fraternity mate turns her head instead.

title: SUMMER ISLAND
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Ruby ends her estrangement from her famous advice-guru mother in order to write a tell-all.

title: THE WOMAN IN CABIN 10
author: Ruth Ware
description: A travel writer on a cruise is certain she has heard a body thrown overboard, but no one believes her.

title: CURIOUS MINDS
author: Janet Evanovich and Phoef Sutton
description: The first of a new series featuring Emerson Knight, an eccentric millionaire, and Riley Moon, an analyst at a mega-bank.

title: ROGUE LAWYER
author: John Grisham
description: The attorney Sebastian Rudd is a “lone gunman” who hates injustice and the system and defends unpopular clients.

title: WITH EVERY BREATH
author: Maya Banks
description: The killer who terrorized Eliza as a teenager is suddenly free on a legal loophole, in a continuation of the Slow Burn series.

title: INSIDIOUS
author: Catherine Coulter
description: Two cases — one concerning an attempted poisoning in Washington and another about the hunt for a serial killer in Los Angeles — are the focus of Coulter’s 20th F.B.I. thriller.

title: THE PACT
author: Jodi Picoult
description: When a teenage girl commits suicide, her boyfriend is accused of murder.

title: THE MEMORY BOX
author: Eva Natiello
description: When a suburban mom Googles herself, she's met with quite a surprise.

title: ME BEFORE YOU
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A young woman who has barely been farther afield than her English village finds herself while caring for a wealthy, embittered quadriplegic.

title: SEE ME
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A couple in love are threatened by secrets from the past.

title: AFTER YOU
author: Jojo Moyes
description: In a sequel to “Me Before You,” Louisa Clark tries to put her life back together after the death of Will Traynor.

title: THE WHISTLER
author: John Grisham
description: A whistleblower alerts a Florida investigator to judicial corruption involving the Mob and Indian casinos.

title: THE GIRL ON THE TRAIN
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller set in the environs of London is full of complications and betrayals.

title: SEX, LIES  AND SERIOUS MONEY
author: Stuart Woods
description: The New York lawyer Stone Barrington’s client needs help spending the fortune he won in the lottery, as well as protection from scheming bad guys.

title: SMALL GREAT THINGS
author: Jodi Picoult
description: A medical crisis entangles a black nurse, a white supremacist father and a white lawyer.

title: TWO BY TWO
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A man who became a single father when his marriage and business collapsed learns to take a chance on a new love.

title: ESCAPE CLAUSE
author: John Sandford
description: Virgil Flowers of the Minnesota Bureau of Criminal Apprehension must deal with the theft of tigers from the local zoo.

author: Fredrik Backman
description: A curmudgeon's gruff exterior masks a generosity of spirit. Originally published in Sweden in 2014.

description: Vince Flynn’s character, the C.I.A. operative Mitch Rapp, uncovers a dangerous Russian plot. Flynn died in 2013.

author: Brent Weeks
description: The fourth book in the fantasy Lightbringer series follows “The Broken Eye.”

author: Dan Brown
description: The symbologist Robert Langdon, on the run in Florence, must decipher a series of codes created by a Dante-loving scientist.

description: A satirical tale of a man on trial for trying to segregate a school and introduce slavery to his home. Winner of the 2016 Man Booker Prize.

description: Two families grapple with love, loss and loneliness at the holidays.

description: The doctor who reconditioned Theo seeks to eliminate the woman whose love he can't remember.

description: Five decades in the lives of two families remade by divorce.

title: THE BLACK BOOK
author: James Patterson and David Ellis
description: After a raid on a brothel that serviced Chicago’s elite, two people are dead and the madam’s black book has disappeared. Who is responsible?

title: LILAC GIRLS
author: Martha Hall Kelly
description: A story of three women’s lives during and after World War II.

title: A MAN CALLED OVE
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A curmudgeon's gruff exterior masks a generosity of spirit. Originally published in Sweden in 2014.

title: THE WOMAN IN CABIN 10
author: Ruth Ware
description: A travel writer on a cruise is certain she has heard a body thrown overboard, but no one believes her.

title: ROBERT B. PARKER'S LITTLE WHITE LIES
author: Ace Atkins
description: Spenser is on the trail of a con man who has duped lovers, investors and military contractors; a continuation of the series by Parker, who died in 2010.

title: BIG LITTLE LIES
author: Liane Moriarty
description: Who will end up dead, and how, when three mothers with children in the same school become friends?

title: 16TH SEDUCTION
author: James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
description: In San Francisco, Detective Lindsay Boxer and the Women’s Murder Club face their toughest case yet.

title: INTO THE WATER
author: Paula Hawkins
description: In this psychological thriller by the author of “The Girl on the Train,” women are found drowned in a river in an English town.

title: AGAINST ALL ODDS
author: Danielle Steel
description: A mother must learn to let her adult children make their own decisions.

title: THE FIX
author: David Baldacci
description: The detective Amos Decker (“Memory Man”) witnesses a murder-suicide that turns out to be a matter of national security.

title: THE HANDMAID'S TALE
author: Margaret Atwood
description: In a dystopian future, men and women perform the services assigned to them.

title: GOLDEN PREY
author: John Sandford
description: Lucas Davenport, now a U.S. Marshal, pursues a thief who robbed a drug cartel and killed a child in Biloxi, Miss.

title: DETECTIVE CROSS
author: James Patterson
description: Is a mad bomber the real thing or a twisted hoax artist? Alex Cross and his wife can't wait around to find out.

title: AMERICAN GODS
author: Neil Gaiman
description: A man just out of prison becomes entangled in the schemes of an enigmatic grifter.

title: PRIVATE: GOLD
author: James Patterson and Jassy Mackenzie
description: Joey Montague looks into his business partner's apparent suicide while protecting an American tourist.

title: SECRETS IN DEATH
author: JD Robb
description: Lt. Eve Dallas investigates the murder of a professional gossip who dabbled in blackmail; by Nora Roberts, writing pseudonymously.

title: ENEMY OF THE STATE
author: Kyle Mills
description: Vince Flynn's character Mitch Rapp leaves the C.I.A. to go on a manhunt when the nephew of a Saudi King finances a terrorist group.

title: A LEGACY OF SPIES
author: John le Carré
description: Peter Guillam, formerly of the British Secret Service, is pulled out of retirement to defend intelligence operations during the cold war that resulted in the deaths of people close to him.

title: IT
author: Stephen King
description: The collective clown phobias of seven teenagers are rekindled in their adult lives by the terrifying title character. Originally published in 1986.

title: DARK LEGACY
author: Christine Feehan
description: Emeline Sanchez fights to recover from exchanging blood with a master vampire, even as she tries to heal the children she saved from him. A Carpathian novel.

title: Y IS FOR YESTERDAY
author: Sue Grafton
description: The 25th Kinsey Millhone mystery novel. A former student from an elite private school is released from prison and a sociopath returns to haunt the detective.

title: THE WESTERN STAR
author: Craig Johnson
description: The 13th Walt Longmire novel. A parole hearing of a serial killer and the decades-old memory of a train ride with Wyoming sheriffs put Longmire on a collision course between past and present.

title: PROOF OF LIFE
author: J A Jance
description: When J. P. Beaumont is asked to investigate the death of his nemesis, it leads to an old case once thought solved.

title: BEFORE WE WERE YOURS
author: Lisa Wingate
description: A South Carolina lawyer, researching her grandmother’s past, learns about a Tennessee orphanage that kidnapped children and placed them for adoption with wealthy people. Based on a real-life scandal.

title: GLASS HOUSES
author: Louise Penny
description: Chief Superintendent Gamache regrets not acting on a hunch when a body is discovered.

title: THE WOMAN IN CABIN 10
author: Ruth Ware
description: A travel writer on a cruise is certain she has heard a body thrown overboard, but no one believes her.

title: THE WHISTLER
author: John Grisham
description: A whistleblower alerts a Florida investigator to judicial corruption involving the Mob and Indian casinos.

title: THE RIGHT TIME
author: Danielle Steel
description: The author Alexandra Winslow, writing under the pseudonym Alexander Green, creates a double life that isolates her.

title: OUTLANDER
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: An English nurse is transported back to 1743 during a second honeymoon in the Scottish Highlands.

description: The bounty hunter Stephanie Plum juggles the investigation of a crime in an ice cream factory and the two men in her life.
